alert.note: Alert for Hubbard (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 8:51PM CDT until June 25 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Minnesota, including the following county, Hubbard. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and an additional one inch is possible. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nevis, Dorset, Chamberlain and Badoura.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
